topics.body:
"@Thanotos Omega":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5516a23d636872121b400200#post_5516a23d636872121b400200
He needed an excuse to motivate people. Admittedly, had he waged war all in the name of sacred Germany instead of anti-Judaism things could've gone better. He was a soldier in WW1, he fought alongside fellow German-Jew soldiers.
That was his first grave mistake, one of many. 

And while you and most of the world see him as a monster during his time the Germans saw him as beacon of hope so that Germany would rise again.

Also,
"@igotnopicks":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5516aeaf6368721458140500#post_5516aeaf6368721458140500
Yao Ming is a special case. Folks like him are rare.

topics.body:
"@Gizoid101":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5516c9ba63687213914f0a00#post_5516c9ba63687213914f0a00
Don't just dig straight down.
Check your surroundings. There might be caverns and hidden dungeons.

Core fragments are usually found just before finding magma. So if you already found magma and yet no core fragments, try looking around.
